data.event: Roseville was laid out in 1812 by Ezekiel Rose.
It was initially named New Milford, but the name had been changed to Roseville by the time a post office was applied for in 1830.

event.title: 1833, Roseville had a gristmill and saw

data.event: By 1833, Roseville had a gristmill and saw mill.
Roseville was incorporated in 1840, with Dr. James Little elected as the first mayor.

The Ransbottom Pottery Company was founded in Roseville in 1900, and later merged with Robinson Clay Products Company to become Robinson-Ransbottom Pottery Company; Robinson-Ransbottom ceased operations in 2005.
